Line 307: Line 307:
There were also negotiations between Vice President [[Omar Suleiman]] and members from the opposition, including {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Morsi|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ ÙØ±Ø³Ù}} and [[El-Sayyid el-Badawi]]. The Muslim Brotherhood said it was taking part in a dialogue with the government.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 |title=BBC News - Egypt unrest |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Suleiman agreed to a plan to set up a committee of judiciary and political figures to study constitutional reforms. Results of the committee are due by early March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110206/D9L7B7IO0.html |title=Egypt's regime makes new concessions to opposition |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> [[Naguib Sawiris]], who was also involved in the talks, said that "big progress" had been made.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hall |first=Camilla |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-07/egyptian-credit-risk-falling-to-lowest-since-protests-started.html |title=Egypt Credit Risk Falls to Lowest Since Start of Protests as Crisis Eases |publisher=Bloomberg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
There were also negotiations between Vice President [[Omar Suleiman]] and members from the opposition, including {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Morsi|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ ÙØ±Ø³Ù}} and [[El-Sayyid el-Badawi]]. The Muslim Brotherhood said it was taking part in a dialogue with the government.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 |title=BBC News - Egypt unrest |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Suleiman agreed to a plan to set up a committee of judiciary and political figures to study constitutional reforms. Results of the committee are due by early March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110206/D9L7B7IO0.html |title=Egypt's regime makes new concessions to opposition |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> [[Naguib Sawiris]], who was also involved in the talks, said that "big progress" had been made.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hall |first=Camilla |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-07/egyptian-credit-risk-falling-to-lowest-since-protests-started.html |title=Egypt Credit Risk Falls to Lowest Since Start of Protests as Crisis Eases |publisher=Bloomberg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
